intro: Argentina commutata, commonly known as the Argentine thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. Its fruit is a rounded berry that changes color from green to yellow as it matures. Argentina commutata is often found in dry, open habitats and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
